description: A charming riverside cafe with artisanal coffee and homemade pastries.
name: The Thames Grind

description: Modern minimalist cafe in Shibuya, known for its single-origin drip coffee and serene atmosphere.
name: Zen Coffee Bar

description: Traditional Argentine cafe with a historic feel, serving strong coffee and medialunas.
name: Café Tortoni

description: Classic Viennese coffee house with chandeliers, marble tables, and a wide selection of cakes.
name: Café Central

description: Hipster cafe in Fitzroy known for its excellent brunch and specialty coffee.
name: Industry Beans

description: Rooftop bar with views over the city's rooftops
name: Sunset Bar

description: Historic Belle Époque cafe near the Opéra Garnier
name: Café de la Paix

description: Elegant Michelin-starred restaurant offering innovative French cuisine with a focus on seasonal ingredients.
name: Le Jules Verne

description: Authentic Thai cuisine in a traditional setting, known for its complex curries and fresh seafood.
name: Blue Elephant

description: World-renowned restaurant offering a modern take on traditional Mexican flavors.
name: Pujol

description: Celebrated restaurant blending Peruvian ingredients with Japanese culinary techniques.
name: Maido

description: Innovative gastronomy and unique fermentations at this world-famous Danish restaurant.
name: Noma

description: Three Michelin stars with panoramic views of Rome
name: La Pergola

description: Legendary techno club with a strict door policy and marathon parties.
name: Berghain / Panorama Bar

description: Multi-room venue hosting international DJs and diverse electronic music nights.
name: Warehouse Elementenstraat

description: Iconic superclub known for its spectacular productions and world-class DJs.
name: Ushuaïa Ibiza Beach Hotel

description: Legendary multi-room club in Farringdon, a staple of London's electronic music scene.
name: fabric

description: Famous beach club and open-air disco with a party atmosphere.
name: Nammos Village

description: Historic and vibrant covered market with spices, sweets, textiles, and souvenirs.
name: Grand Bazaar

description: Lively kitchen market offering fresh produce, seafood, pickles, and local delicacies.
name: Nishiki Market

description: Historic public market overlooking the Elliott Bay waterfront in Seattle.
name: Pike Place Market

description: Largest and oldest indoor market in Budapest, offering fresh produce, meats, pastries, and souvenirs.
name: Great Market Hall (Nagy Vásárcsarnok)

description: Famous square and market with snake charmers, food stalls, and crafts.
name: Djemaa el-Fna

description: Iconic lifestyle destination with luxury retail, a rooftop infinity pool, and an observation deck.
name: Marina Bay Sands Shoppes

description: Large downtown shopping mall with a distinctive glass galleria and a wide range of retailers.
name: CF Toronto Eaton Centre

description: Impressive mall at the base of the Petronas Towers, featuring luxury brands and entertainment.
name: Suria KLCC

description: One of the largest shopping malls in Asia, offering a vast selection of shops, restaurants, and entertainment.
name: Siam Paragon

description: Historic 19th-century glass-covered arcade with luxury boutiques and elegant cafes.
name: Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II

description: Observation deck on the 86th floor of the iconic Art Deco skyscraper, offering 360-degree views.
name: Empire State Building Observatory

description: Giant Ferris wheel on the South Bank of the River Thames offering stunning city views.
name: The London Eye

description: Observation deck on the 94th floor of the former John Hancock Center, with thrilling TILT experience.
name: 360 Chicago Observation Deck

description: Broadcasting and observation tower, the tallest structure in Japan, offering panoramic city views.
name: Tokyo Skytree

description: Television tower in central Berlin offering 360° views of the city and a revolving restaurant.
name: Berliner Fernsehturm (TV Tower)

description: Showcases a vast collection of historic aircraft and spacecraft.
name: National Air and Space Museum

description: Home to an extensive collection of ancient Egyptian antiquities.
name: The Egyptian Museum

description: Features masterpieces by Goya, Velázquez, and El Greco, among others.
name: Prado Museum

description: One of the largest and oldest museums in the world, housing a vast collection of Western European Art.
name: The State Hermitage Museum

description: Home to masterpieces by Rembrandt, Vermeer, and Hals.
name: Rijksmuseum

description: Collection of Renaissance masterpieces.
name: Uffizi Gallery

description: The world's most visited museum, home to the Mona Lisa.
name: Louvre Museum

description: Iconic series of fortifications built across the historical northern borders of ancient Chinese states.
name: Great Wall of China (Mutianyu Section)

description: Multi-venue performing arts centre with a distinctive sail-shaped design.
name: Sydney Opera House

description: Historic fortified complex in the heart of Moscow, serving as the official residence of the President of Russia.
name: The Moscow Kremlin

description: Ivory-white marble mausoleum on the south bank of the Yamuna river, a symbol of eternal love.
name: Taj Mahal

description: Ancient citadel located on a rocky outcrop above the city of Athens, containing the Parthenon.
name: Acropolis of Athens

description: Iconic Roman amphitheater, symbol of Imperial Rome.
name: Colosseum

description: Wrought-iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars.
name: Eiffel Tower
